question: who is the longest serving manager in manchester united history
api_result: The longest-serving manager in Manchester United's history is Sir Alex Ferguson. He managed the club from November 1986 to May 2013, totaling approximately 26 and a half years. During his tenure, Ferguson won numerous trophies, including 13 Premier League titles, 5 FA Cups, and 2 UEFA Champions League titles, making him the most successful manager in the history of Manchester United and one of the most acclaimed football managers in the world.
